title: Multi-page website navigation + Home layout + consistent theme

requirements.summary: Add persistent header navigation with client-side routing between Home and Search across mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: A persistent header navigation is visible on all pages.
Users can navigate to Home and Search using the header without full page reloads.
Navigation works on mobile and desktop layouts.

file_operations.description: Create a responsive, persistent site header with navigation links to Home and Search using TanStack Router navigation primitives and shadcn-ui Button styling where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Create a shared layout that renders SiteHeader above an Outlet/content area so navigation remains consistent across routes.

Refactor TanStack Router setup so the root route renders SiteLayout and child routes render their pages, enabling persistent header navigation without full page reloads. Update routes to ensure distinct Home and Search entry pages are reachable from the header.

requirements.summary: Create a website-style Home page with a hero section and a primary CTA that routes into the existing Search experience.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page contains at least: a hero section (headline + short description) and a primary CTA that routes into the Search flow.
Layout is responsive and readable on narrow screens.
No broken links or placeholder lorem ipsum text remain.

file_operations.description: Implement a Home page with a hero (headline + concise description) and a primary CTA button that navigates to the Search Home page using TanStack Router navigation. Use shadcn-ui Button for consistent CTA styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new HomePage into the router as the '/' route, and move the existing search home experience to a dedicated Search route so the Home CTA can route into the Search flow.

requirements.summary: Add a consistent footer across main pages with basic site links and a copyright line.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer is present across the main pages.
Footer styling matches the rest of the site and works in both light and dark mode (if supported by the existing theme).

file_operations.description: Create a site footer containing links to Home and Search plus a short copyright line, using theme tokens for light/dark compatibility.
Render SiteFooter beneath the main content so it appears across the Home, Search Home, and Search Results pages.
Remove page-local footer markup (now handled by SiteLayout) and ensure its internal navigation continues to route into the Search Results flow after route changes.
Remove page-local footer markup (now handled by SiteLayout) and keep the results page focused on search header+results content.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent site-wide visual theme and consistent styling across Home, Search Home, and Search Results without a blue/purple-dominant palette.
acceptanceCriteria: Home, Search Home, and Search Results share consistent typography and spacing scale.
Buttons, inputs, and links have consistent styling and hover/focus states.
The theme does not use a blue/purple dominant palette unless already present in the current design tokens.

file_operations.description: Adjust global theme tokens (e.g., primary/ring hues) away from a blue/purple-dominant palette while preserving light/dark support, and add minimal base styling for consistent typography/links/focus across pages.
Ensure header navigation visual states (active/hover/focus) align with the updated theme tokens and remain usable on mobile and desktop.

Align Home hero spacing, typography, and CTA styling with the shared theme (use shadcn-ui Button for primary action; avoid custom one-off styles). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update layout spacing/typography so the Search Home page matches the same website styling (container widths, vertical rhythm) as Home and Search Results, while continuing to use the existing SearchForm (which composes shadcn-ui Input/Button). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update container/spacing/typography for consistency with Home and Search Home, ensuring SearchForm and ResultsList presentation matches the site-wide theme (including hover/focus states). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
